adm:managed-object.name: dictionary-password-validator
adm:managed-object.adm:synopsis:
The
determines whether a proposed password is acceptable based on whether the given password value appears in a provided dictionary file.
adm:managed-object.adm:description: A large dictionary file is provided with the server, but the administrator can supply an alternate dictionary. In this case, then the dictionary must be a plain-text file with one word per line.

adm:property.name: dictionary-file
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Specifies the path to the file containing a list of words that cannot be used as passwords.
adm:property.adm:description:
It should be formatted with one word per line. The value can be an absolute path or a path that is relative to the
instance root.

adm:defined.adm:value: For Unix and Linux systems: config/wordlist.txt. For Windows systems: config\\wordlist.txt

adm:pattern.adm:synopsis: The path to any text file contained on the system that is readable by the server.

adm:property.name: case-sensitive-validation
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Indicates whether this password validator is to treat password characters in a case-sensitive manner.
adm:property.adm:description: If it is set to true, then the validator rejects a password only if it appears in the dictionary with exactly the same capitalization as provided by the user.

adm:property.name: test-reversed-password
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Indicates whether this password validator is to test the reversed value of the provided password as well as the order in which it was given.
adm:property.adm:description: For example, if the user provides a new password of "password" and this configuration attribute is set to true, then the value "drowssap" is also tested against attribute values in the user's entry.

adm:property.name: check-substrings
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Indicates whether this password validator is to match portions of the password string against dictionary words.
adm:property.adm:description: If "false" then only match the entire password against words otherwise ("true") check whether the password contains words.

adm:property.name: min-substring-length
adm:property.adm:synopsis: Indicates the minimal length of the substring within the password in case substring checking is enabled.
adm:property.adm:description: If "check-substrings" option is set to true, then this parameter defines the length of the smallest word which should be used for substring matching. Use with caution because values below 3 might disqualify valid passwords.
